questions.question: You won't get the job ............................. you pass the test.
questions.description: Unless means if not. It is used to express a condition.

questions.question: You must learn to stand up .............................. yourself.
questions.description: To stand up for yourself is to defend yourself.

questions.question: Nobody thought she would be brave enough to stand up ............................... him.
questions.description: To stand up to somebody is to not allow them to treat you badly.

questions.question: Please tell ................................. to leave.
questions.description: There is no preposition before tell and its object.

questions.question: .................................. they worked overtime, they could not finish the project on time.
questions.description: Although is a conjunction. It is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: I would be grateful if you ............................... help me with this.
When plants die, they give ............................... gases such as carbon dioxide.
questions.description: To give something off is to produce it.

questions.question: It is time you ..............................
questions.description: We use a past tense with a present meaning after It is time.

questions.question: He is ………………………… older than his wife.
questions.description: We cannot use very with comparative adjectives.

questions.question: What are you wearing ………………………… your sweater?
Have you got ………………………… razor blades?
questions.description: We use any in questions and some in affirmative sentences.
